items.name: 大鹏所城
items.description: 明代海防要塞，保存完好的明清海防体系，被誉为'沿海所城，大鹏为最'
items.descriptionFull:
大鹏所城，全称为"大鹏守御千户所城"，位于广东省深圳市大鹏新区鹏城社区，是明清两代中国海防的军事要塞，有"沿海所城，大鹏为最"之称，是鸦片战争肇始地，有明清的海防历史和滨海客家文化氛围。深圳又别称"鹏城"，即源于此，被誉为"鹏城之根"。大鹏所城文化根脉深厚，聚集了来自天南地北的兵将，融合了客家文化、疍家文化、广府文化和海防文化，诞生了深圳最早的移民文化。
 大鹏所城建于明洪武二十七年（1394年），即海防卫所，所城平面呈近梯形布局，占地约10万平方米，城墙高6米、长1200米，上设雉堞654个，并辟有马道。全城分东、西、南、北四个城门（北门于明万历年间被堵塞），每个城门上建有一座敌楼，两边各设两个警铺。城外东、西、南三面，环绕着一条长1200米、宽5米、深3米的护城濠。城内现存清广东水师提督赖恩爵的振威将军第、清福建水师提督刘起龙的将军第等十余座清代府第式建筑，以及侯王庙、天后宫、赵公祠等古迹。
 自明初建城以来，大鹏所城一直担负着深港地区的海防安全，多次抵御和抗击了葡萄牙、倭寇和英国殖民主义者的入侵，是明清时期反抗外侮、捍卫主权的主要海防堡垒之一，是我国目前保存较为完整的明清海防军事城堡之一。2001年6月25日，大鹏所城被中华人民共和国国务院公布为第五批全国重点文物保护单位，成为深圳市首个全国重点文物保护单位。2024年6月15日，南门城墙发生小范围坍塌，现已设立安全围挡并组织专家进行全面评估。
items.descriptionEn: A well-preserved Ming and Qing coastal defense fortress, known as 'the best among coastal defense cities'. It is Shenzhen's only national cultural relic protection unit, built in 1394 during the 27th year of the Hongwu reign of the Ming Dynasty. It has a history of more than 600 years of resisting foreign aggression, producing outstanding national heroes such as Lai Enjue, Liu Qilong, and Liu Heizai.

items.name: 南头古城
items.description:
南头古城，又称"新安故城"，地处珠江入海口东岸，位于广东省深圳市南山区南头天桥北，占地面积约38.5万平方米，建筑面积约51.7万平方米。
南头古城内保存有纪念文天祥的信国公文氏祠、东莞会馆、南城门洞、报德祠等超20处文保单位、历史建筑 [20]。自东晋咸和六年（331年）设置东官郡起，已有近1700年的历史，是深圳特区成立前宝安县政府所在地，被誉为"深港历史文化之根""粤东首府、港澳源头"，是深圳城市的原点，南头古城承载见证了深圳中心的"迁移与回归"。是历代岭南沿海地区的行政管理中心、海防要塞、海上交通和对外贸易的集散地。南头古城主街风貌以广府建筑风格为基调，既保留了广府文化的精髓，同时注入了现代商业元素。
1988年，南头古城被公布为深圳市文物保护单位。2018年，南头古城被列为"深圳十大特色文化街区"之一。
items.descriptionEn:
Nantou Ancient City, also known as "Xin'an Ancient City", is located on the east bank of the Pearl River Estuary, north of Nantou Overpass in Nanshan District, Shenzhen, Guangdong Province, covering an area of about 385,000 square meters with a construction area of about 517,000 square meters.
The ancient city preserves more than 20 cultural relics protection units and historical buildings, including the Wen Tianxiang Memorial Temple, Dongguan Guild Hall, South City Gate, and Baode Temple. With a history of nearly 1,700 years since the establishment of Dongguan Commandery in the 6th year of Xianhe in the Eastern Jin Dynasty (331 AD), it was the seat of Bao'an County Government before the establishment of Shenzhen Special Economic Zone, known as the "Root of Shenzhen-Hong Kong Historical Culture" and "Capital of Eastern Guangdong, Source of Hong Kong and Macao". It is the origin of Shenzhen city, witnessing the "migration and return" of Shenzhen's city center. It was the administrative center, coastal defense fortress, and distribution center for maritime transportation and foreign trade in Lingnan coastal areas throughout history. The main street of Nantou Ancient City features Cantonese architectural style as the keynote, retaining the essence of Cantonese culture while integrating modern commercial elements.
In 1988, Nantou Ancient City was announced as a Shenzhen Municipal Cultural Relics Protection Unit. In 2018, it was listed as one of the "Top Ten Characteristic Cultural Blocks in Shenzhen".

title.zh: 南头古城 - 深圳文化遗产
title.en: Nantou Ancient City - Shenzhen Cultural Heritage

description.zh: 南头古城是深圳历史最悠久的古城，见证了深圳从汉代到现代的历史变迁。
description.en: Nantou Ancient City is Shenzhen's oldest ancient city, witnessing Shenzhen's historical changes from the Han Dynasty to modern times.

items.name: 鹤湖新居
items.description:
鹤湖新居，又称鹤湖围，是深圳"新客家之都"的标志性建筑，深圳十大客家古村落之一 。深圳市主要旅游景点之一，深圳重要的文化名片之一。

鹤湖新居被誉为"客家第一围"。它是中国目前规模最大的客家围村建筑群，是深圳现存300多座客家围屋中保存最完整、最具代表性的一座。

鹤湖新居位于广东省深圳市龙岗区龙岗街道南联社区罗瑞合北街1号，清乾隆年间（1736年-1795年），鹤湖新居开基祖罗瑞凤始建鹤湖新居，至道光年间（1782年-1850年）整体建成。鹤湖新居建筑占地14432平方米，总占地（包括半月池、禾坪）约25000平方米。

鹤湖新居是全国最大的客家围屋之一，由内外两围相套而成，布局错落有致，号称"九厅十八井，十阁走马廊"，是深港地区城堡式围楼的典型代表，是"客家人开发深圳东部的历史见证"，被誉为"客家文化的活化石"，堪称深圳客家围屋的"第一豪宅"，是客家人开拓深圳地区的历史见证，被誉为客家民居建筑艺术的结晶。体现了深圳本土客家人勤劳勇敢、自耕自足、奋斗不息的精神，为研究深圳历史、文化、民俗和建筑等提供了重要的依据。"龙岗罗"的良好家风家训还颇有教育意义。 鹤湖新居继承了中原府第式建筑，赣南客家四角楼和粤东兴梅客家围龙屋的传统，同时融进了当地广府民系"斗廊式"（一天井、两廊、一厅、两房）住房的优点。

1998年，鹤湖新居成为深圳市级文物保护单位，2002年，鹤湖新居成为第四批广东省文物保护单位。2018年，鹤湖新居被评选为"龙岗新十景"之一。
items.descriptionEn:
Hehu Xingu, also known as Hehu Wei, is a landmark building of Shenzhen's "New Hakka Capital" and one of Shenzhen's top ten Hakka ancient villages. It is one of Shenzhen's main tourist attractions and important cultural cards.

Hehu Xingu is known as the "First Hakka Enclosure". It is currently the largest Hakka enclosed village complex in China and the most complete and representative among the more than 300 preserved Hakka enclosed houses in Shenzhen.

Located at No. 1, Luoruihe North Street, Nanlian Community, Longgang Street, Longgang District, Shenzhen, Guangdong Province, Hehu Xingu was first built by its founding ancestor Luo Ruifeng during the Qianlong period (1736-1795) of the Qing Dynasty and was completed during the Daoguang period (1782-1850). The construction area of Hehu Xingu is 14,432 square meters, with a total area (including crescent pond and threshing ground) of about 25,000 square meters.

As one of the largest Hakka enclosed houses in China, Hehu Xingu consists of two enclosed rings nested together with a well-arranged layout, known as "Nine halls and eighteen wells, ten pavilions with corridor". It is a typical representative of castle-style enclosed buildings in the Shenzhen-Hong Kong area, a "historical witness to the Hakka development of eastern Shenzhen", and is praised as a "living fossil of Hakka culture", known as the "first mansion of Hakka enclosed houses in Shenzhen". It is a historical witness to the Hakka pioneering of the Shenzhen area and is praised as a crystallization of Hakka residential architectural art. It embodies the spirit of diligence, courage, self-sufficiency and perseverance of the local Hakka people in Shenzhen, providing important basis for studying Shenzhen's history, culture, folk customs and architecture. The good family traditions of the "Longgang Luo" family are also quite educational. Hehu Xingu inherits the traditions of central plains mansion architecture, southern Jiangxi Hakka four-corner buildings and eastern Guangdong Xingmei Hakka round houses, while incorporating the advantages of the local Cantonese "dou-lang" style (one courtyard, two corridors, one hall, two rooms) housing.

In 1998, Hehu Xingu became a Shenzhen municipal cultural relic protection unit. In 2002, it became the fourth batch of Guangdong provincial cultural relic protection units. In 2018, Hehu Xingu was selected as one of the "New Ten Scenes of Longgang".

items.name: 咸头岭遗址
items.description: 深圳最早的史前文化遗址，距今约7000年，展现了珠三角地区早期人类文明。咸头岭遗址是一处新石器时代中期至晚期的贝丘遗址，位于深圳市大鹏新区南澳街道，总面积约30000平方米，出土了大量陶器、石器、玉器等文物，为研究珠三角地区早期人类文明提供了重要资料。
items.descriptionEn: Shenzhen's earliest prehistoric cultural site, dating back about 7000 years, showing early human civilization in the Pearl River Delta region. Xiantouling Site is a shell mound site from the mid to late Neolithic period, located in Nan'ao Street, Dapeng New District, Shenzhen, covering an area of about 30,000 square meters. A large number of pottery, stone tools, jade articles and other cultural relics were unearthed, providing important materials for studying early human civilization in the Pearl River Delta region.

title.zh: 咸头岭遗址 - 深圳文化遗产

description.zh: 深圳最早的史前文化遗址，距今约7000年，展现了珠三角地区早期人类文明。
description.en: Shenzhen's earliest prehistoric cultural site, dating back about 7000 years, showing early human civilization in the Pearl River Delta region.

items.name: 文天祥纪念馆
items.description: 纪念南宋民族英雄文天祥的纪念馆，展示其生平事迹和崇高精神。文天祥纪念馆位于深圳市南山区，建筑面积约1200平方米，分为生平事迹、文学成就、后世影响三个部分，通过文物、图片、文字等多种形式，全面展示了文天祥的生平事迹和崇高精神。
items.descriptionEn: Memorial hall commemorating Wen Tianxiang, a national hero of the Southern Song Dynasty, showcasing his life story and noble spirit. Located in Nanshan District, Shenzhen, with a construction area of about 1,200 square meters, it is divided into three parts: life story, literary achievements, and influence. Through cultural relics, pictures, texts and other forms, it comprehensively displays Wen Tianxiang's life story and noble spirit.

title.zh: 文天祥纪念馆 - 深圳文化遗产
title.en: Wen Tianxiang Memorial Hall - Shenzhen Cultural Heritage

description.zh: 纪念南宋民族英雄文天祥的纪念馆，展示其生平事迹和崇高精神。
description.en: Memorial hall commemorating Wen Tianxiang, a national hero of the Southern Song Dynasty, showcasing his life story and noble spirit.

items.name: 大万世居
items.description: 深圳第二大客家围屋，保存完好的清代客家建筑群。大万世居建于清乾隆五十六年（1791年），是深圳地区保存完好的清代客家建筑群，占地面积约15000平方米，建筑面积约12000平方米，共有144间房。
items.descriptionEn: Shenzhen's second largest Hakka enclosed house, well-preserved Qing Dynasty Hakka architectural complex. Built in 1791 during the Qing Dynasty, it is a well-preserved Qing Dynasty Hakka architectural complex in Shenzhen, covering an area of about 15,000 square meters with a construction area of about 12,000 square meters, containing 144 rooms.
